title: 2024 Annual Report Released
excerpt: The PSH Advisory Committee has released its annual report to the Legislature, highlighting key recommendations for enhancing permanent supportive housing coordination.
content:
# 2024 Annual Report Released

The Permanent Supportive Housing Advisory Committee is pleased to announce the release of our 2024 Annual Report to the Washington State Legislature.

## Key Highlights

- **Regional Investment Analysis**: Comprehensive review of PSH distribution across Washington State
- **Quality Assessment Framework**: New strategies for continuous improvement
- **Stakeholder Engagement**: Enhanced community participation in decision-making

## Priority Recommendations

1. Increase targeted investments in underserved rural communities
2. Develop capacity-building programs for smaller organizations
3. Implement standardized quality metrics across all PSH programs

[Download the full report](/documents/2024-annual-report.pdf)
author: PSH Advisory Committee

title: New Committee Members Appointed
excerpt: The Department of Commerce has appointed three new members to the PSH Advisory Committee, bringing valuable expertise in rural housing development and lived experience.
content:
# New Committee Members Appointed

We are excited to welcome three new members to the Permanent Supportive Housing Advisory Committee.

## New Appointments

- **Sarah Johnson**: Rural housing developer with 15 years of experience
- **Michael Chen**: PSH resident advocate and peer support specialist
- **Dr. Lisa Martinez**: Behavioral health researcher focusing on housing stability

These appointments strengthen our committee's commitment to diverse representation and ensure all voices are heard in shaping PSH policy.
author: Commerce Communications
